ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I have developed my conversational skills in ASL. MY confidence has increased and my knowledge of deaf history and culture.
I learned so much more ASL!
More about Deaf culture and sign

This class helped to greatly increase my fluency in American sign language, while also informing me about Deaf History and Deaf Culture. On a practical level, it made me incredibly more comfortable conversing with others in ASL.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths- this is a brilliant class- the weekly syllabus means it is easy to know where you are and what to expect. the teaching is also brilliant. Professor Conlin created a classroom that felt like a safe place to continue learning language and that it was ok to make mistakes. 

Weaknesses: there are a couple of elements of the course that are slightly disorganised which means at the end of the course there are suddenly a lot of deadlines. but this is easily managed when it has all been explained.
No weaknesses. Would recommend highly. Kind teachers, easy to learn, good community.

A strength of this course was definitely having Professor Conlin as an instructor. Prof. Conlin consistently found ways to make class both engaging, yet entertaining. She incorporated a nice balance of different teaching methods, so that it was accommodating for students with different learning styles. This course also offered the opportunity for students to immerse themselves in the ASL community at Yale. The ASL at Yale Community is growing rapidly, and I am pleased to be a part of this group here at Yale. 

One weakness of the course is perhaps the fact that there were many more homework assignments in this course than there were in either ASL I or II. I realize that this is expected, as students are progressing through the language; however, I did not expect such a sharp increase in assignments.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES - this is a great course, so much fun and the proofs are some of the nicest at yale and are brilliant teachers.

Absolutely. The ASL program at Yale is one of the most cohesive campus communities I've been a part of. You'll leave with a lot of knowledge about the language, as well as Deaf art and culture. Couldn't recommend more.
Yes, you are really missing out if you do not take this course.

Yes, without a doubt. This class helped me feel much more confident conversing in ASL. The course also greatly refined my ASL grammar and storytelling skills. Finally, this class offers plentiful opportunities to connect with the Yale ASL Community at large. This community is composed of many kind individuals who truly express a love for this language.
